{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of fever, headache, and ataxia, along with the brain imaging findings of dilated ventricles and significant basal exudates, suggest a diagnosis of tuberculous meningitis. Document [2] and Document [5] both describe the typical cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) findings in tuberculous meningitis as lymphocytosis, low glucose, and high protein. Therefore, the most likely CSF finding in this patient would be lymphocytosis, low glucose, and high protein.", "answer_choice": "A"}
